text: - Bosch's mission is to develop products
that are invented for life.
In North America, Bosch Thermotechnology,
the HVAC division,

we are a leading source of
high-quality heating, cooling,
and hot water systems.
We began our IoT journey in 2017

with the launch of our
first connected thermostat,

a solution hosted on
shared server resources.

Our solution at the time
forced us to not only develop

the compelling use cases
our customers valued

but also build and maintain
the underlying infrastructure

that provided no additional
value to customers

while adding significant
operational complexity
and cost to the business.

In 2020, we made the
strategic decision to migrate
to AWS Serverless to minimize this burden
of managing servers and infrastructure,
making it a lot easier for our teams
to deliver on new features,
all the while reducing costs.

This year, we launched two
exciting new technologies

our first connected heat pump,
the IDs Premium Connected,

and our IoT mobile hub, the
Bosch EasyAir mobile app.

Both of these technologies
were built entirely
with AWS Managed Services,
from AWS IoT Core and AWS Lambda
to Amazon SQS and Amazon API Gateway.

The EasyAir mobile app
provides contractors

with real-time installation
support, remote diagnostics,

troubleshooting support, and
in-app product registration.

When we were architecting
the infrastructure
for this solution,

we knew from experience
that we wanted to move away
from managing servers and infrastructure.
We also knew

that our solution would not
require 24/7 compute resources
but would require flexible auto-scaling
to meet times of peak demand
without compromising on performance.

We agreed that it would be
best to leverage AWS Lambda
to meet our compute requirements.
The additional benefits

of Lambda's pay-for-what-you-use
pricing model
also allowed us to save costs
during application idle times.
Bosch Thermotechnology in North America
has a very strong partnership with AWS.
We have several meetings every week
with the group of AWS experts,

all working collaboratively
to train our engineering teams

to follow best practices
and answer any questions.
When you work with AWS,
you truly feel that they care
as much about your customer as you do,
and that's truly special.

We are undergoing a very
exciting digital transformation

at Bosch Thermotechnology
in North America,

and we see AWS as a
critical partner to enable
and accelerate that change.
(upbeat music fades)
